birth_place.zh-cn: 清朝山西省代州直隶州五台县
birth_place.en: Wutai County, Daizhou, Shanxi, Qing dynasty

death_place.zh-cn: 中华民国台湾省台北市

description.zh-cn: 中华民国军事及政治人物，晋系军阀领袖，曾统治山西长达38年。
description.en: A Chinese warlord who served in the government of the Republic of China. He effectively controlled the province of Shanxi for 38 years.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国军事家、政治家，曾任中华民国总统。
description.en: A Chinese military and political leader who served as the leader of the Republic of China.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国军事家、政治家，桂系军阀领袖，曾任中华民国副总统、代总统。
description.en: A prominent Guangxi warlord and Kuomintang military commander who served as vice president and acting president of the Republic of China.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国军事家、政治家，西北军阀领袖。
description.en: A warlord and leader in Republican China from Henan, who was known as the 'Christian General'.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国军事家、政治家，奉系军阀领袖张作霖之子。
description.en: The effective ruler of Northeast China and much of northern China after the assassination of his father, Zhang Zuolin, by the Japanese on 4 June 1928.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国陆军一级上将，曾任行政院院长、国防部部长。
description.en: A general of the Republic of China, and one of the most senior generals of the Kuomintang (KMT) during Republican China.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国陆军一级上将，曾任行政院院长、副总统。
description.en: A Chinese political and military leader, and one of the main commanders of the National Revolutionary Army during the Second Sino-Japanese War and the Chinese Civil War.

description.zh-cn: 阎锡山堂妹，山西省妇女会理事长。
description.en: Cousin of Yan Xishan, director of the Shanxi Provincial Women's Association.

description.zh-cn: 阎锡山亲信，山西省政府代主席。
description.en: A confidant of Yan Xishan and acting chairman of the Shanxi Provincial Government.

description.zh-cn: 清末军事将领及革命党人，曾计划与阎锡山组织燕晋联军，后被刺杀。
description.en: A military commander and revolutionary in the late Qing dynasty, who planned to form the Yan-Jin Allied Army with Yan Xishan before being assassinated.

description.zh-cn: 中国晚清时期重要政治、军事人物，北洋军阀的奠基人，曾任中华民国临时大总统，后称帝。
description.en: A Chinese military and government official who rose to power during the late Qing dynasty and eventually ended the Qing dynasty rule of China in 1912, later becoming the Emperor of China.

description.zh-cn: 中国近代民主革命家、政治家、中华民国国父。
description.en: A Chinese statesman, physician, and political philosopher, who served as the provisional first president of the Republic of China and the first leader of the Kuomintang (Nationalist Party of China).

description.zh-cn: 中华民国政治人物，中国国民党内重要人物。
description.en: A Chinese politician and a prominent figure in the Kuomintang.

en: Ministry of National Defense (Republic of China)

description.zh-cn: 1930年在中国发生的一场大规模军阀混战，一方为执政的国民政府与蒋介石，另一方为阎锡山、冯玉祥、李宗仁等地方实力派。
description.en: A large-scale warlord conflict in China in 1930, pitting the ruling Nationalist Government and Chiang Kai-shek against regional military leaders including Yan Xishan, Feng Yuxiang, and Li Zongren.

description.zh-cn: 第二次国共内战后期的一场大型战役，中国人民解放军攻占了阎锡山长期控制的山西省省会太原。
description.en: A major campaign during the late stage of the Chinese Civil War, where the People's Liberation Army captured Taiyuan, the capital of Shanxi province, which had long been controlled by Yan Xishan.

description.zh-cn: 推翻清朝并建立中华民国的革命。
description.en: A revolution that overthrew China's last imperial dynasty, the Qing dynasty, and established the Republic of China.

description.zh-cn: 抗战期间阎锡山试图清除其军队中的中共党员，导致新军公开叛变并倒向共产党。
description.en: An incident during the Second Sino-Japanese War where Yan Xishan attempted to purge communists from his army, leading to the open rebellion of the New Army which sided with the communists.

description.zh-cn: 第二次国共内战初期，解放军在山西上党地区对阎锡山军队的一场歼灭战。
description.en: The first major battle of the second phase of the Chinese Civil War, in which the PLA annihilated Yan Xishan's forces in the Shangdang region of Shanxi.

description.zh-cn: 徐竹青是阎锡山的正妻。
description.en: Xu Zhuqing was Yan Xishan's primary wife.

description.zh-cn: 徐兰森是阎锡山的妾。
description.en: Xu Lansen was Yan Xishan's concubine.

description.zh-cn: 阎慧卿是阎锡山的堂妹。
description.en: Yan Huiqing was Yan Xishan's cousin.

description.zh-cn: 辛亥革命太原起义成功后，阎锡山被推举为山西都督。
description.en: After the success of the Taiyuan Uprising during the Xinhai Revolution, Yan Xishan was elected as the military governor of Shanxi.

description.zh-cn: 与吴禄贞商讨组织燕晋联军，共同反清。
description.en: Conspired with Wu Luzhen to organize the Yan-Jin Allied Army to fight against the Qing dynasty.

description.zh-cn: 袁世凯曾派兵进攻山西，阻挠阎锡山回太原。
description.en: Yuan Shikai once sent troops to attack Shanxi and obstruct Yan Xishan's return to Taiyuan.

description.zh-cn: 孙中山于1912年9月视察山西，与阎锡山密谈，鼓励其保守山西革命基地。
description.en: Sun Yat-sen inspected Shanxi in September 1912, had a secret talk with Yan Xishan, and encouraged him to defend the revolutionary base in Shanxi.

position.zh-cn: 国民革命军北路总司令；国民革命军第三集团军司令
position.en: Commander-in-Chief of the Northern Route Army of the National Revolutionary Army; Commander of the Third Group Army of the National Revolutionary Army

description.zh-cn: 因“国军编遣事件”与蒋介石发生分歧，通电讨蒋，引发中原大战。
description.en: Disagreed with Chiang Kai-shek over the 'National Army Disbandment Incident' and issued a telegram denouncing Chiang, which triggered the Central Plains War.

description.zh-cn: 在中原大战中与冯玉祥结盟，共同反对蒋介石。
description.en: Allied with Feng Yuxiang during the Central Plains War to jointly oppose Chiang Kai-shek.

description.zh-cn: 在中原大战中与李宗仁结盟，共同反对蒋介石。
description.en: Allied with Li Zongren during the Central Plains War to jointly oppose Chiang Kai-shek.

description.zh-cn: 张学良通电支持蒋介石，并派兵入关，导致阎锡山在中原大战中失败。
description.en: Zhang Xueliang declared his support for Chiang Kai-shek and sent troops into the Shanhai Pass, leading to Yan Xishan's defeat in the Central Plains War.

description.zh-cn: 阎锡山在中原大战中战败，宣布下野并赴大连。
description.en: Yan Xishan was defeated in the Central Plains War, announced his retirement from politics, and went to Dalian.

description.zh-cn: 阎锡山试图控制的山西新军公开叛变并倒向共产党，使其在与中共的权力斗争中受挫。
description.en: The Shanxi New Army, which Yan Xishan tried to control, openly mutinied and defected to the Communist Party, causing a setback in his power struggle with the CCP.

description.zh-cn: 阎锡山部在战役中被解放军歼灭3.5万人，遭受重创。
description.en: Yan Xishan's forces were annihilated by the PLA in the campaign, with 35,000 casualties, suffering a major blow.

description.zh-cn: 在第二次国共内战期间，阎锡山作为国民党将领与中国人民解放军作战。
description.en: During the second Chinese Civil War, Yan Xishan, as a KMT general, fought against the People's Liberation Army.

description.zh-cn: 中国人民解放军攻占太原，结束了阎锡山在山西长达38年的统治。
description.en: The People's Liberation Army captured Taiyuan, ending Yan Xishan's 38-year rule in Shanxi.

description.zh-cn: 在太原城破后自杀。
description.en: Committed suicide after the fall of Taiyuan.

description.zh-cn: 在太原城破后自杀。
description.en: Committed suicide after the fall of Taiyuan.

description.zh-cn: 阎锡山在重庆提议进行土地改革，遭到陈立夫的愤怒反对。
description.en: Yan Xishan proposed land reform in Chongqing, which was met with angry opposition from Chen Lifu.

description.zh-cn: 阎锡山接替何应钦出任行政院院长及国防部长。
description.en: Yan Xishan succeeded He Yingqin as Premier of the Executive Yuan and Minister of National Defense.

description.zh-cn: 阎锡山辞去行政院院长职务，由陈诚接任。
description.en: Yan Xishan resigned as Premier of the Executive Yuan, and was succeeded by Chen Cheng.
